get.summary: Return the main character of the player account to which the character ID belongs.
get.description:
Needs role: app-chars.
It is possible that an account has no main character.

404.description: Character (or player) not found. (default reason phrase)

get.summary: Return the main character of the player account to which the character ID belongs.
get.description:
Needs role: app-chars.
It is possible that an account has no main character.

get.summary: Return the player account to which the character ID belongs.

200.description: The player, only id and name properties are returned.

get.summary: Return all characters of the player account to which the character ID belongs.

200.description: All characters from the player account.

get.summary: Return all characters from the player account.

200.description: All characters from the player account.

get.summary: Return all characters that were removed from the player account to which the character ID belongs.

200.description: All removed characters from the player account.

get.summary: Return a list of all players that have a character in the corporation.

200.description: List of players, only id and name properties are returned.

parameters.name: inactive
parameters.description: Limit to members who have been inactive for x days or longer.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Limit to members who were active in the last x days.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: Limit to members with (true) or without (false) an account.

200.description: Members ordered by logonDate descending (character and player properties excluded).

get.summary: Makes an ESI GET request on behalf on an EVE character and returns the result.
get.description:
Needs role: app-esi
* Public ESI routes are not allowed.
* The following headers from ESI are passed through to the response: Content-Type Expires X-Esi-Error-Limit-Remain X-Esi-Error-Limit-Reset X-Pages warning
* The HTTP status code from ESI is also passed through, so maybe there's more than the documented.
* The ESI path and query parameters can alternatively be appended to the path of this endpoint, see doc/app-esi-examples.php for more.

parameters.name: esi-path-query
parameters.description: The ESI path and query string (without the datasource parameter).

parameters.name: datasource
parameters.description: The EVE character ID those token should be used to make the ESI request

400.description: Bad request, see reason phrase and/or body for more.

429.description: Maximum permissible ESI error limit reached (this is lower than X-Esi-Error-Limit-Remain).

post.summary: Makes an ESI POST request on behalf on an EVE character and returns the result.
post.description:
Needs role: app-esi
* Public ESI routes are not allowed.
* The following headers from ESI are passed through to the response: Content-Type Expires X-Esi-Error-Limit-Remain X-Esi-Error-Limit-Reset X-Pages warning
* The HTTP status code from ESI is also passed through, so maybe there's more than the documented.
* The ESI path and query parameters can alternatively be appended to the path of this endpoint, see doc/app-esi-examples.php for more.

parameters.name: esi-path-query
parameters.description: The ESI path and query string (without the datasource parameter).

parameters.name: datasource
parameters.description: The EVE character ID those token should be used to make the ESI request

400.description: Bad request, see reason phrase and/or body for more.

429.description: Maximum permissible ESI error limit reached (this is lower than X-Esi-Error-Limit-Remain).

get.summary: Return groups of the character's player account.
get.description:
Needs role: app-groups.
Returns only groups that have been added to the app as well.

get.summary: Return groups of the character's player account.
get.description:
Needs role: app-groups.
Returns only groups that have been added to the app as well.

post.summary: Return groups of multiple players, identified by one of their character IDs.
post.description:
Needs role: app-groups.
* Returns only groups that have been added to the app as well. * Skips characters that are not found in the local database.

200.description: List of characters (id, name and corporation properties only) with groups.

get.description:
Needs role: app-groups.
Returns only groups that have been added to the app as well.

Needs role: app-groups.
Returns only groups that have been added to the app as well.

post.description:
Needs role: app-groups.
* Returns only groups that have been added to the app as well. * Skips corporations that are not found in the local database.

200.description: List of corporations with groups but without alliance.

get.description:
Needs role: app-groups.
Returns only groups that have been added to the app as well.

Needs role: app-groups.
Returns only groups that have been added to the app as well.

post.description:
Needs role: app-groups.
* Returns only groups that have been added to the app as well. * Skips alliances that are not found in the local database.

get.summary: Returns groups from the character's account, if available, or the corporation and alliance.
get.description:
Needs role: app-groups.
* Returns only groups that have been added to the app as well.
* It is not checked if character, corporation and alliance match.

groups.description: Groups for automatic assignment (API: not included by default).

validToken.description:
Shows if character's refresh token is valid or not.

If there is no refresh token this is null.

validTokenTime.description: Date and time when that valid token property was last changed.

groups.description: Groups for automatic assignment (API: not included by default).

CorporationMember.description: The player property contains only id and name, character does not contain corporation.

name.description: A unique group name (can be changed).

GroupApplication.description: The player property contains only id and name.

name.description:
A name for the player.

This is the EVE character name of the current main character or of
the last main character if there is currently none.

removedCharacters.description: Characters that were removed from a player (API: not included by default).

reason.description: How it was removed (deleted or moved to another account).
